hotspots.hotspot:
Tropic of Cancer

The Tropic of Cancer circles Earth at 23½°N latitude. It is the northernmost point on Earth to receive the direct rays of the sun—on about June 21—bringing the Northern Hemisphere its longest day of sunlight. This date, known as the summer solstice, marks the beginning of summer in the Northern Hemisphere.

Tropic of Capricorn

The Tropic of Capricorn circles Earth at 23½°S latitude. This line is the southernmost point on Earth to receive the direct rays of the sun—on about December 22. This day is the winter solstice—the day of shortest daylight and the beginning of the winter season in the Northern Hemisphere.

Arctic Circle

From about March 20 to about September 23 (spring and summer in the Northern Hemisphere), the polar area north of the Arctic Circle (66½°N latitude) experiences continuous daylight or twilight. The other half of the year is spent in darkness.

Antarctic Circle

From about September 23 to about March 20 (spring and summer in the Southern Hemisphere), the polar area south of the Antarctic Circle (66½°S latitude) experiences continuous daylight or twilight. The other half of the year is spent in darkness.

Prime Meridian

Because Earth does not have an east pole and a west pole, some point had to be chosen as the starting point for measuring longitude. By international agreement, the Royal Observatory in Greenwich, England, was selected.

At the edge of the Tropics—at about 30°N and 30°S latitude—are bands of calm air called the "horse latitudes." In the days of sailing ships, crews were often stranded for days in these windless areas. To take advantage of the slightest breeze, sailors tossed cargo and livestock overboard, giving rise to the name "horse latitudes."

multiple.question: Human geography describes Earth's land, climate, water, and plant and animal life.
A society's location determines how it develops.
Northwest, northeast, southeast, and southwest are cardinal directions.
Latitude and longitude are measured in feet.
Political maps show the boundaries of countries, states, counties, territories, and other political subdivisions.
Only a globe can show direction, distance, shape, and size accurately.
Maps that show land features are called physical maps.
A map showing the extent of the Roman Empire is a physical map.
Relative location is determined by latitude and longitude.
Absolute location is determined by latitude and longitude.
